name: ripeness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of fruit or crops) the quality of being ready to be collected or eaten: Cooking time will vary according to the ripeness of the pears. The fruit should reach its maximum ripeness after a few days.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople sometimes thump a watermelon to test its ripeness.At end of the day, pickers sort the cherries according to their ripeness.Mr Kennedy had reached his greatest ripeness of thought and experience when he published this volume.The wine has a nutty ripeness like a mature cheese.The ripeness of the comedian's language deterred some audience members.
